column4: hi, why did Ubuntu remove support for /proc/bus/usb/* ? Will I void any warranties :) if I enable it?
Ubuntu comes with absolutely no warranties if I remember correctly
that was the joke part
ahh ok funny :)
mine is in /media/0FA4-1EEA/dists/lucid
obviously your path is different but yeah you found it
yeah
apt-get upgrade
apt-get upgrade also does not update any packages... 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
this is on 10.04 server?
there is a bug with MOTD not being updated
any workarounds?
He doesn't appear to be online right now. I can ask him later if he found a fix.
but essentially MOTD is not being updated.
all right, thank you
I'll try to find the bug report
by the way this system is not server but was server last time I installed 10.04. I have formatted the / partition. using the same /home I used with the server
I am not sure if it affects server only or both server and desktop but my friend had the exact same issue.
might want to ask in #ubuntu-server if anybody has seen this

I was looking at https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/sysvinit/+bug/659738... And I found this in /etc/motd.tail: 106 packages can be updated. 61 updates are security updates.... :) Somehow it was hardcoded in motd...
modifying /etc/motd.tail seems to work for now. (Unless something appends to it again for some reason)
nice job figuring it out :)
